Maximum Value on a Subset

Source: R/filter_confirmation.R
max_cond.Rd

The function derives the maximum value of a vector/column on a subset of entries/observations.

max_cond(var, cond)

Arguments

var

A vector

cond

A condition

Author

Stefan Bundfuss

Examples


library(dplyr)
library(admiralonco)
data <- tibble::tribble(
  ~USUBJID, ~AVISITN, ~AVALC,
  "1",      1,        "PR",
  "1",      2,        "CR",
  "1",      3,        "NE",
  "1",      4,        "CR",
  "1",      5,        "NE",
  "2",      1,        "CR",
  "2",      2,        "PR",
  "2",      3,        "CR",
)

group_by(data, USUBJID) %>% mutate(
  first_cr_vis = min_cond(var = AVISITN, cond = AVALC == "CR"),
  last_pr_vis = max_cond(var = AVISITN, cond = AVALC == "PR"),
  pr_after_cr = last_pr_vis > first_cr_vis
)
#> # A tibble: 8 x 6
#> # Groups:   USUBJID [2]
#>   USUBJID AVISITN AVALC first_cr_vis last_pr_vis pr_after_cr
#>   <chr>     <dbl> <chr>        <dbl>       <dbl> <lgl>      
#> 1 1             1 PR               2           1 FALSE      
#> 2 1             2 CR               2           1 FALSE      
#> 3 1             3 NE               2           1 FALSE      
#> 4 1             4 CR               2           1 FALSE      
#> 5 1             5 NE               2           1 FALSE      
#> 6 2             1 CR               1           2 TRUE       
#> 7 2             2 PR               1           2 TRUE       
#> 8 2             3 CR               1           2 TRUE
